project: Our application helps people visualize their home furniture and decide if it's suitable or not, and what furniture will fit best in your space without any cost or effort. It facilitates trying more than one piece of furniture together and check how they all look like. Giving an “in-store experience” for the ones who can’t visit the store themselves. It also has 3D furniture models that are quite accurate that can сonvey the real-life sizes, and you are allowed to add these models into 3D scenes, save, share designs and view furniture in AR.

A brief story from 2017 till now, 
I joined the diploma on 2017, cycle 0 
It had a huge impact on me and encouraged me to change my major from telecom to computer engineering
At that time I studied some unity development course hoping to be a good game developer 
I participated in a contest at "ORCAS VR", then  I met a friend there and she asked me of I want to join her start up "OCU Trek" and we made an educational vr game concept but we didn't finish it
then I became an intern at "5d VR" where I made new friends and I became more curios about learning 3d modeling and 3d art 
then I took a maya diploma at Russian culture center 
then I made my graduation project "facial motion capture : python + maya 3d"
then I studied some online course about 3d, graphic design and video editing 
and I liked vfx alot 
after fulfilling military service , I have joined ITI (which I'm currently in) to be an 3d fx artist in Sidefx Houdini, hopefully I will finish it in 1 month from now.

Bio:

name: Hagar Hesham Negm
Bio: I studied Computer Engineering during my undergraduate studies. Towards the end of my studies, I wanted to explore the realm of game development because it had always been one of my interests. I started taking the AR/VR course provided by 412 Labs. I really enjoyed the course and after finishing it I started considering VR game development as a potential career path. I have always thought it would be interesting to incorporate AI technology within VR games. After graduating, I decided to pursue a Master's degree in Data Science and AI. I finished my post graduate studies in 2022.
project: My final project was a simulation of the Apollo 11 moon landing. The simulation takes the player through the launch of the spacecraft and all the way through to the landing of the lunar module. Once the player lands on the moon, they are free to walk around and explore. The walk simulates weightlessness on the moon. The project includes actual models of the spacecrafts provided by the NASA website. It also includes actual recordings of the launch and the landing.

name: Nariman Nashaat Gamil Ahmed Shehab
speciality: Virtual Reality in Wayfinding Studies of institutional buildings in terms of complex layouts
Bio: Currently, I am working as Teaching Assistant in Modern Sciences and Arts University (MSA) in 6th of October City. Also, I am MSA Graduate class 2018 from Architecture Engineering faculty, the same year I have recieved the diploma by 2018-2019. In 2019,  i have been registered into Cairo University as a Master Degree candidate. My thesis is discussing an interdicsplinary material between Architecture Engineering (i.e Environmental Psychology such as Wayfinding) and Computer Science ( Object Oriented Programing in Virtual and Augmented Reality). Besides, i am currently working as Internal Trainer in Research and Development Department in MSA, Technology Development Team, as an approach to enhance the curriculums in all of the scientific faculties to obtain visual and interactive lectures via VR and AR. In response to the Egyptian Ministry of Higher Education intitiative of Digitalization and Digital Transformation, our approach was to train staff members to develop interactive applications using AR and VR and use Experiential Learning Technique via Immersive VR Headset, and VR Box, in order to reach Generation Z's communication language of learning and meet the learning outcomes. Then, i have been certified by CPD United Kingdom (UK) in Training of Trainers (TOT) in order to reach professionalism while developing content and expand the knowledge to a wider community with different scientific backgrounds.
project: I am proposing a solution for navigational disorientation, designing a methodology and conducting guidelines for architect, designers and planners to pre-test wayfinding performance in complex buildings (i.e: Malls, Universities, Hospitals, etc.) before being constructed in order to design an inclusive buildings that save time, money, and resources. Thus, the diploma has helped me a lot in drafting a methodology to measure and test the wayfinding performance in institutional complex buildings through measuring task execution time and percentage of errors. The experience is a part of my master thesis in which 70 random sample of participants are included to test the variables in 8 different virtual simulated environment in order to test the impact of physical environmental characteristics of complex plan layouts on the formation of cognitive mapping to facilitate the decision of paths for inclusive buildings users. The wayfinding experience for each participant was recorded via Rock VR for further investigation to conduct scientific and statistical results.

name: Omar Mohamed Taha Mohamed Afifi Elbanna
Bio: I am a computer engineer graduate who loves computers and has passion in game development. I self learned game development in unity after I graduated and joined many games jams world wide including one in UAE and one here in Egypt iTi. Later on I also got interested in VR when I tried it out in a event and got fascinated with the technology and had to learn it and thankfully to this diploma I did. As for achievements I joined for iTi game jam 2022 and lead developer team and artists to develop a 3D game in two days for a Game Jam . We spend all these 2 days working hard on ideas and coding the game to be playable for the Game Jam and I am proud from what we achieved that day.
project: Dark age is a VR game that focuses on intense with horror  elements based in a metro lines after the world was destroyed by nukes. The game goal is to put the player in an intense situation that will need all his focus and quick reaction to survive the mutated deadly creatures in this apocalyptic world.

name: Ali Ahmed
Bio: I graduated from GUC in 2020. My graduation project topic was Personality Traits and Presence in Virtual Environments. I'm very passionate about gaming and VR/AR. However, I'm working as Software Engineer with interest in Site Reliability Engineering.
project: A virtual car showroom to see your car in different customizations and configurations.

name: ashraf saad
Bio: I am Ashraf Saad Shewail  obtained my bachelor’s degree in computer science in in May 2017, currently I  works as teaching assistant at computer science department, Faculty of Computers and Artificial intelligence, Benha University, Egypt. i am working on my M.Sc. degree. My research interest’s concern with Virtual and Augmented reality, Image Processing, Computer Vision, Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence.
project: The purpose of our system is to promote public and high school students' scientific literacy about remote education of theoretical and experimental chemistry. It offers a laboratory option for students with impairments who are interested in chemistry but have limited mobility. Increasing the benefits of virtual reality on undergraduate students’ self-efficacy, self-concept, interest. we wanted the application to help reduce (any) laboratory anxiety students may have with respect to setting up organic chemistry reactions under a fume hood. The main objective of this system are familiarization with the equipment of a chemical laboratory and execution of virtual experiments

name: Ibrahim Alaa Nasr
Bio: I am a student at the faculty of computers and information systems at Ain Shams University, I originally enrolled at this school for my love of video games and `i started to learn how to make them at high school, and it has been going on ever since and of course my field of study helped to aid that, moving forward I have worked on making video games with the technical side as well as the game design aspect of it and the event organizing and planning which were gameJams(game dev competitions that goes on for a couple of days) and this was a virgin territory for me that I unexpectedly enjoyed.
project: it was remastering the 1980's Atari Duck hunt game that relied heavily on giving the user a retro experience with a natural feel and bright colors where you can shoot ducks
